title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 January 2012 - XWiki
content:

08:37 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* rd04c460 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/xwiki/internal/resources/SearchRESTResource.java : XWIKI-7426: Search should be case insensitive on XWiki Repository - http://git.io/HTUsGA  
08:38 <CIA-121> tmortagne stable-3.4.x \* rdcf7e61 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/xwiki/internal/resources/SearchRESTResource.java : XWIKI-7426: Search should be case insensitive on XWiki Repository - http://git.io/ydNjmw  
08:50 <vmassol> tmortagne: good morning  
08:50 <vmassol> just wanted to know if I can commit my changes (ie the move of some apps from XE to platform)?  
08:50 <vmassol> (ie will l10n recognize my @deprecated keys?)  
08:50 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes it should  
09:01 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is something weird on jenkins: "org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:3.2.1"  
09:01 <+tmortagne> looks like for some reason master is trying to build with packager 3.2.1  
09:04 <vmassol> ah yes  
09:04 <vmassol> I know  
09:05 <vmassol> I've fixed this locally  
09:05 <vmassol> this is because sergiu has released 3.2.1  
09:05 <vmassol> which is the latest released version now  
09:05 <+tmortagne> I tough maven was comparing version, you mean it takes the latest in date ?  
09:05 <vmassol> yes probably  
09:05 <+tmortagne> not very nice...  
09:06 <vmassol> fixing  
09:06 <+tmortagne> in any case we should enforce taking the snapshot and not the last release probably  
09:09 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* rf809705 / (12 files in 8 dirs): XE-1091: Move Livetable pages into their own Platform Module ...

09:09 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* ra5d4629 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-livetable/pom.xml : XWIKI-7420: Add new Livetable Module ...  
09:09 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* r7f31b37 / (3 files in 2 dirs): XE-1091: Move Livetable pages into their own Platform Module ...

09:13 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <CIA-121> Vincent Massol master \* rbb10ca0 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-linkchecker/xwiki-platform-linkchecker-test/pom.xml : [Misc] Fix build by forcing the packaging plugin version (the new build error is caused by the recent 3.2.1 release) - http://git.io/XFcnpA  
09:55 <AdminLDAP> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <+tmortagne> looks like I have a corrupted document on l10n ( http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XEXWikiCoreResources\_-1231373157\_activitystream-event-deleteAnnotation-rss-title\_en ), any idea how to fix that ? impossible to save it whatever the modification  
09:57 <AdminLDAP> Hi, I'm having trouble with group mapping with admin.ldap extension, it creates another XWiki space named "%0D%0AXWiki"... any idea about what could be wrong?  
09:59 <+tmortagne> AdminLDAP: as far as I know this extension cause lots of issues, better not use it  
10:03 <AdminLDAP> thanks a lot +tmortagne, would it be ok using the xwiki conf files instead of the plugin?  
10:05 <+tmortagne> AdminLDAP: depends what's you use case but if you don't have separated LDAP configurations by wiki in a wiki farm yes xwiki.cfg is probably the safest  
10:06 <+tmortagne> but you will probably have to cleanup a bit what the extension did  
10:06 <+tmortagne> look at XWikiPreferences page with object editor and search for LDAP properties  
10:07 <+tmortagne> or delete this page and reimport it if you did not already done some configuration or changes the right configurations  
10:07 <AdminLDAP> yep, I tried to clean it.. but I'll go back to the backup I had.. it really messed up everything.. I don't really know a better way to get back  
10:08 <+tmortagne> I don't know exactly what this extension is doing, it's supposed to only touch XWikiPreferences page but looks like it's doing some crap around  
10:10 <AdminLDAP> yep, no better explanation ;) have a nice day, and thanks for your support!  
10:12 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <+tmortagne> AdminLDAP: you'r welcome :)  
10:22 <CIA-121> Denis Gervalle master \* r88299de / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/AttachmentSelector.xml : XE-1097: Document name is not properly escaped in url of AttachmentSelector - http://git.io/WBYaVw  
10:23 <+mflorea> guys, I'd like to remove the 3.2 and 3.3 jobs from CI. I'll add 3.4.  
10:29 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <+tmortagne> mflorea: +1  
10:30 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <florinciu> has quit  
10:38 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki

10:42 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* rc90a638 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects/src/main/java/org/xwiki/test/po/appwithinminutes/ApplicationClassEditPage.java : Add link to Selenium issue. - http://git.io/MZxayA

10:49 <CIA-121> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.4.x \* ra3930e3 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/pom.xml : Fix dependency version. ...  
10:53 <AdminLDAP> has quit  
11:16 <vmassol> has quit  
11:19 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <recompile> has quit  
12:04 <vmassol> I'm going to remove the functional-tests packaging in the end  
12:04 <vmassol> it doesn't help for various reasons  
12:04 <vmassol> 1) we need to specify the packager plugin version  
12:05 <vmassol> 2) func tests need to generate a jar for the PageObjects  
12:05 <vmassol> 3) it can cause issues with extension in the build cycle  
12:05 <vmassol> because of 1 and 2, it doesn't take more lines in the pom not to have the packaging  
12:29 <kayasaman> hi am wondering if it's ok to ask a question here or is the preferred method through the mailing lists?  
12:36 <vmassol> kayasaman: both are fine, people will answer if they know the answer and have some time  
12:38 <kayasaman> ok :-) it's just my first time with IRC and I don't wanto give the impression that am demanding anything either  
12:39 <kayasaman> apologies if that impression has been give already!  
12:40 <vmassol> nope don't worry  
12:40 <kayasaman> few :-)  
12:51 <Enygma`> has quit  
12:51 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:14 <mflorea> has quit  
13:37 <kayasaman> has quit  
13:38 <kayasaman> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <+Denis> Boolean expression complexity is 6 (max allowed is 3)…. is that new ?  
13:52 <vmassol> forget what I said earlier, I'm changing strategy in the end...  
13:52 <vmassol> Denis: not that I know of  
13:52 <+Denis> what should I do, silly stuffs ?  
13:52 <vmassol> hein?  
13:52 <vmassol> checkstyle is not there to cause pain quite the opposite  
13:53 <vmassol> it's here to not cause design issues  
13:53 <vmassol> if you've found a rule that isn't good you should discuss it  
13:53 <+Denis> yes if I need 6 && to check something is like something else, what should I do ?  
13:55 <florinciu> has quit  
13:59 <+Denis> vmassol: it is faster to write something silly than to discuss :P  
13:59 <vmassol> no  
13:59 <vmassol> you're just pushing the problem to others  
13:59 <vmassol> it's not faster at all  
13:59 <vmassol> it's selfish  
14:00 <vmassol> :)  
14:00 <+Denis> I have never voted checkstyle, and this could be a very long discussion  
14:00 <vmassol> it's called tech debt  
14:00 <+Denis> I have not introduce this silly rule  
14:00 <vmassol> we can change rules  
14:00 <vmassol> you just need to propose a change  
14:01 <vmassol> we can tune them even  
14:01 <vmassol> we should decide something about the fan out complexity one (don't remmeber if it's this one or another)  
14:01 <+Denis> this is not the first one which cause me issue, but I really found this one silly  
14:01 <vmassol> since I've seen several excludes  
14:01 <vmassol> I don't know what rule you're talking about btw  
14:02 <+Denis> the boolean complexity on  
14:02 <+Denis> e  
14:02 <vmassol> link?  
14:02 <vmassol> I don't know the 60 rules by heartr :)  
14:02 <+Denis> http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/config\_metrics.html  
14:02 <+Denis> its the first one  
14:03 <vmassol> strange I don't recall seeing violations for this one  
14:04 <+Denis> basically, what I do is comparing to object based on their interfaces, and there is 5 methods in the interface, so my complexity is 5  
14:04 <vmassol> would  need to see your code to know if it's good or not but the rule sounds good  
14:05 <+Denis> I do not seen the point really  
14:05 <vmassol> (they usually think long and hard about the threshold)  
14:05 <vmassol> the point is what they say  
14:05 <vmassol> "Rationale: Too many conditions leads to code that is difficult to read and hence debug and maintain."  
14:05 <+Denis> it is a incomplete rules, it should consider what the expression are, how many object are concerned, etc...  
14:05 <lucaa> has quit  
14:05 <+Denis> it is not true by itself  
14:08 <+Denis> vmassol: http://pastebin.com/imCz0N94  
14:09 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:09 <recompile> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <+Denis> vmassol: let me know if you think my initial code was difficult to read :)  
14:11 <vmassol> (chrome restarting)  
14:14 <+Denis> (be patient :D )  
14:16 <vmassol> ì don't agree with your second version  
14:18 <vmassol> I prefer something like this instead:  
14:18 <vmassol> (I'm assuming what you're doing is correct in term of design but I would need to know more - for ex this looks very close to an equals() impl)  
14:18 <vmassol> boolean isSimilar = true;  
14:18 <vmassol> isSimilar = isSimilar && (this.isReadOnly() == description.isReadOnly());  
14:18 <vmassol> isSimilar = isSimilar && (this.getDefaultState() == description.getDefaultState());  
14:18 <vmassol> …  
14:18 <vmassol> return isSimilar;  
14:19 <vmassol> (this is the equivalent of a single line return split over several lines)  
14:20 <kayasaman> does anyone know how to get rid of the white space/box to the right of the logo section on the Toucan skin?  
14:22 <kayasaman> i did it once but never took notes and now am lost :-(  -  couldn't find anything on Google either after vigerous search  
14:23 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <lucaa> has quit  
14:28 <vmassol> kayasaman: don't know but I can tell you how to find the solution :)  
14:28 <vmassol> you need to use a tool like firebug on FF  
14:28 <vmassol> to see what's causing it  
14:29 <kayasaman> vmassol: that would be great  
14:31 <kayasaman> vmassol: its somewhere within the CSS definitely and i spent all night trying to analyze the various CSS files to comment out the 'box' section  
14:32 <vmassol> kayasaman: I don't know at all this CSS so I cannot help you much (I'm not a CSS expert either)  
14:33 <kayasaman> vmassol: that makes two of us :-)  
14:36 <kayasaman> vmassol: oh wait! hang on it might be my memory but wasn't it firebug that i used last time..... after clicking on the propery it came up with where it was within the style sheet itself!  
14:37 <kayasaman> vmassol: ok the firebug statement earlier may have been meant for me i got confused??  
14:39 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <+Denis> vmassol: I fully agree, the second is just a hack, but I do not seen the point of the checkstyle rule here  
14:46 <vmassol> I think you made it readable only by the layout  
14:46 <+Denis> and what I do is similar to equals, surely, it ensure a right is equals to a right description  
14:46 <vmassol> if you put it all on the same line you'll see it's not very readable  
14:46 <+Denis> if the && concerned many different object, used many different expression, the presentation would not suffice  
14:47 <vmassol> Denis: I was asking re equals because we're using Commons Lang for equals and it removes the need to do all this  
14:47 <+Denis> and any other way to write it will not be easier to read  
14:48 <+Denis> it is not really equals, since it compare a description to a true object  
14:48 <vmassol> I think you could use the equalsbuilder from commons lang all the same  
14:49 <vmassol> (would need to check what it does specifically but I don't have time now)  
14:55 <+Denis> I will do that, this is probably the clearest way to do it, just hope it will not trigger a Fan-out complexity ;)  
14:55 <vmassol> :)  
15:17 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <lucaa> has quit  
15:30 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <kayasaman> vmassol: thanks for the help... firebug gave me a great view of the html but unforunately didn't help me the way i needed  
15:34 <kayasaman> vmassol: i am currently using the sdiff command to compare and contrast all the files within the skins/ dir on the server to work out what is going on  
15:34 <vmassol> ok...  
15:36 <kayasaman> would be great though to get any insight from anyone familiar with customizing the Toucan skin as there are still some issues i have with changing the background  
15:36 <vmassol> kayasaman: are you sure you really want to customize the toucan skin and not the colibri skin which is newer and nicer?  
15:43 <kayasaman> i worked with the toucan skin before otherwise would mean changing the whole layout  
15:43 <kayasaman> for now let me just get this working but from Wednesday onwards i can look at a different approach  
15:43 <kayasaman> that's when i get my new laptop with 8GB RAM :-)  
15:44 <kayasaman> so i can run a test server in there without any probs ;-)  
15:45 <CIA-121> Eduard Moraru master \* r68f9575 / (2 files): XWIKI-7194: Fix validation (xhtml, webstandards, etc.) issues for the workspaces UI - http://git.io/yVY4vA  
15:46 <vmassol> kayasaman: nice config  
15:47 <kayasaman> vmassol: i plan to do lots of Xwiki stuff then including Xwiki on GlassfishV3 using Nexenta Core 3 as OS  
15:47 <vmassol> cool  
15:48 <kayasaman> did it before but left the notes in turkey during my 2 years there  
15:48 <kayasaman> gota fetch them but won't be any time soon :-(  
15:48 <kayasaman> oh yeah and don't forget lots of documentation....  
15:48 <kayasaman> i would like to add heaps to the Xwiki site like i started already on FreeBSD and migration  
15:56 <kayasaman> BTW I think I figured my issue out... at least for the 'old' style Toucan skin from Xwiki 2.x  
15:57 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
15:57 <kayasaman> In my old file of toucan.css this portion got modified:  
15:58 <kayasaman> under IE and background color  
15:58 <kayasaman> the statement was changed to transparent from #FFF  
16:25 <kayasaman> is there anyway to delete a skin document?  
16:26 <kayasaman> have just managed to create a corrupt skin document and now can't edit it  
16:26 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* r81a0f70 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties : Add some documentation - http://git.io/8pPLhw  
16:36 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:41 <kayasaman> sdumitriu: thanks for the help yesterday :-) i spent lots of last night and all of today and finally i got my Xwiki instance working properly  
16:43 <+florinciu> kayasaman: if you still have the skin issue and you are admin you should be able to delete it like any other document  
16:43 <+florinciu> if your UI is broken try to force the skin from the url using ?skin=colibri  
16:44 <kayasaman> i actually managed to fix it! somehow the Default\_Skin got removed??  
16:45 <kayasaman> i reloaded the DefaultSkin property from the Xwiki-3.1.1.XAR archive as I hadn't done that before  
16:45 <kayasaman> after that was done I changed the skin back to default skin  
16:45 <kayasaman> and was able to edit again :-)  
16:46 <kayasaman> Sergiu told me yesterday NOT to edit the DefaultSkin so after all that i was able to access the WWW\_Skin document i created before  
16:46 <kayasaman> and i removed the offending code within the Object Editor  
16:47 <kayasaman> that set things straight  
16:47 <kayasaman> :-)  
16:47 <CIA-121> tmortagne master \* rb3b70e3 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties : Fix error - http://git.io/mAvJEg  
16:47 <kayasaman> am just wondering though if my way of editing the CSS directly from inside the xwiki/skins/toucan/ dir is right?  
16:48 <kayasaman> should i instead be putting the code within the Presentation part of the Admin Panel?  
16:48 <kayasaman> if so i haven't found any documentation on it but it's no problem to volenteer myself to write it up once i know how of course :-)  
16:50 <+florinciu> we always recommend to use a skin document and not overwrite the filesystem skin unless you specifically need that  
16:50 <kayasaman> how to do that though as have Google'd and found editing skins on the xwiki.org site but doesn't state how to edit the document  
16:51 <kayasaman> each time i tried adding the CSS code into any one of the fields  
16:51 <kayasaman> the UI broke  
16:52 <kayasaman> i tried adding direct CSS code into Skin -> Edit -> Style and Edit boxes but broke UI :-(  
16:53 <+florinciu> you could try the object editor  
16:54 <kayasaman> i did  
16:54 <kayasaman> thats what im trying to explain  
16:54 <kayasaman> that it has several fields  
16:54 <+florinciu> were you still on toucan or on colibri while editing?  
16:54 <kayasaman> Toucan  
16:55 <kayasaman> at the moment i cant move away from it as have no where to test new skin  
16:55 <+florinciu> try from colibri. should work fine until you fix your toucan clone  
16:56 <+florinciu> hmm, the xwiki.org link from for skins in the admin's guide seems incorrect  
16:56 <+florinciu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Skins  
16:56 <+florinciu> I'm not sure that is the proper content  
16:56 <kayasaman> it was done ages ago  
16:56 <kayasaman> as in August 2010  
16:56 <kayasaman> so the content might have got moved or changed URL???  
16:57 <kayasaman> within the Toucan - Skin Editor under Preferences within the Admin Panel I do get these fields:  
16:58 <kayasaman> style, header, footer, view header, view, edit  
16:58 <kayasaman> the issue is that i'm not sure of the syntax that goes into those boxes or which box to use  
17:00 <kayasaman> i tried adding my css file as an attachment then calling: @import bg-mod.css within the style field  
17:00 <kayasaman> that broke the UI  
17:01 <kayasaman> i think the issue is that i simply don't know what im doing!  
17:01 <kayasaman> under the file system is much easier for me... without onhand documentation  
17:03 <CIA-121> Denis Gervalle stable-3.4.x \* r41ae2e9 / xwiki-enterprise-ui/src/main/resources/XWiki/AttachmentSelector.xml : XE-1097: Document name is not properly escaped in url of AttachmentSelector - http://git.io/PHyWpA  
17:04 <+sburjan> hello everybody. Is this page ok ? http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/AdminGuide/Skins  
17:06 <+florinciu> seems broken  
17:07 <+florinciu> in preview it's fine. after saving it's not  
17:08 <+florinciu> kayasaman: that is the page that should contain the documentation you need. should be fixed soon  
17:09 <kayasaman> ok thanks :-)  
17:10 <kayasaman> btw Great job on Xwiki by everyone :-D sorry to go nuts asking for help with what seems like everything as usually i work quite silently from manuals or wikis or howto guides on the net and everything works  
17:10 <kayasaman> so hopefully things will go back to that soon :-)))  
17:11 <kayasaman> then i can just come round for a quick chat if anyone is up for it!  
17:17 <+florinciu> this page might also help: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Skins  
17:18 <kayasaman> i used that :-)  
17:18 <kayasaman> it helped me with changing the DefaulSkin to another skin i made and creating the Object Class within that Skin document  
17:19 <+mflorea> Guys, I'll start the 3.4 final release in a few minutes. Ping me if you have commits pending for 3.4 branch.  
17:20 <sburjan> has quit  
17:20 <vmassol> mflorea: ok thanks, let's cross fingers that it's of good quality since we didn't get much feedback about it  
17:20 <vmassol> (we haven't even installed it on myxwiki.org as we use to do)  
17:22 <pgmjsd> has quit  
17:23 <+mflorea> vmassol: I made CI build 3.4 branch and it went fine. Maybe sburjan` can test 3.4 after I release it on maven  
17:23 <vmassol> mflorea: sure, I was commenting about real world feedback  
17:28 <vmassol> OTOH we have a 3.5 coming quickly behind  
17:28 <+mflorea> tep  
17:28 <+mflorea> yep
